channel.title: Review on Alma Andersson
channel.description: Recent content in Review on Alma Andersson

item.title: Paper Review | Visualizing Data using t-SNE
item.description: t-SNE is one of the most commonly used methods for dimensionality reduction in RNA-seq analysis, yet few people know how it actually works. Here we’ll walk through the original t-SNE paper by van der Maaten and Hinton; looking at the motivation behind it, the mathematics that fuel its power, and how to interpret its hyperparameters.

item.title: Paper Review | Toward a Common Coordinate Framework for the Human Body
item.description: For quite some while now, I’ve carried a slight sensation of guilt within me. Guilt for being so caught up in my own projects and activities that I’ve come to neglect one of the most essential duties as a researcher: to survey, read, and contemplate upon new (and old) material that have been published. It’s so easy to put that interesting paper aside in order to finish a project deadline, as no immediate gains are observed from reading through the former in contrast to completing the latter.
